item.title: 'Pay with cash': Jurors hear a recording of Trump directing Michael Cohen on how to buy a story alleging an affair
item.description: Former fixer Michael Cohen is set to testify about the payments made to Stormy Daniels in Donald Trump's hush money case.

media:content.media:text: Michael Cohen leaves his apartment for Manhattan Criminal Court
media:content.media:description: Michael Cohen leaves his apartment building on his way to Manhattan criminal court on May 13, 2024, in New York City.

item.title: Michael Cohen takes the stand as star witness in Trump's hush money trial
item.dc:creator: Dareh Gregorian and Adam Reiss and Gary Grumbach and Jillian Frankel and Lisa Rubin
item.description: Cohen, who was Trump's lawyer and self-described "fixer," is expected to face days of questioning over a payment that's at the center of the charges against his former boss.

media:content.media:text: Michael Cohen leaves his apartment for Manhattan Criminal Court
media:content.media:description: Michael Cohen leaves his apartment building on his way to Manhattan criminal court on May 13, 2024, in New York City.

item.title: Michael Cohen takes the stand in Trump hush money trial
item.description: Michael Cohen is being questioned by prosecutors about his work with former President Trump and meetings he had on the National Enquirer's coverage of Trump and efforts to catch and kill negative stories about him.

media:content.media:title: Michael Cohen takes the stand in Trump hush money trial
media:content.media:description: Michael Cohen is being questioned by prosecutors about his work with former President Trump and meetings he had on the National Enquirer's coverage of Trump and efforts to catch and kill negative stories about him.

item.title: The man leading Russia’s war in Ukraine is out in a surprise shake-up hinting at Putin’s true focus
item.dc:creator: Yuliya Talmazan and Keir Simmons and Natasha Lebedeva
item.description: This weekend's ouster Sergei Shoigu as Russia's defense minister follows a corruption scandal and a calamitous start to Russia’s invasion of Kraine.

media:content.media:text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has proposed removing Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu from his post. Putin nominated First Deputy Prime Minister Andrey Belousov for the role.
media:content.media:description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Sergei Shoigu, who was removed as defense minister on Sunday.

media:content.media:text: Civilian evacuations as Russian troops push further into northeastern Ukraine.
media:content.media:description: Khrystyna Pyimak hugs her mother, Oksana Velychko, after evacuation from Vovchansk, Ukraine, on Sunday.

media:content.media:text: New Russian Defense Minister Andrey Belousov
media:content.media:description: Then-First Deputy Prime Minister of the Russian Federation Andrey Belousov in Moscow on Thursday.

item.title: U.S. warns Israel won't eliminate Hamas as militants regroup in northern Gaza
item.dc:creator: Raf Sanchez and Chantal Da Silva
item.description: TEL AVIV — The Israeli military intensified its attacks on northern Gaza on Monday, battling a regrouped Hamas in areas it said it had cleared and renewing questions over Israeli strategy in the war as the United States issued some of its harshest public criticism yet.

media:content.media:text: A missile hits a building in northern Gaza
media:content.media:description: A missile hits a building in northern Gaza on May 11, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Civilians evacuate northern Gaza
media:content.media:description: Displaced Palestinians evacuate from the Tal al-Zaatar refugee camp in northern Gaza on Saturday amid renewed fighting in the area.

media:content.media:text: Palestinian children play in the remains of a charred vehicle in Rafah
media:content.media:description: Children play in a burned-out minivan Sunday in Rafah, where hundreds of thousands have fled the IDF's intensifying ground operation.

item.title: Jury selection begins in bribery case against Sen. Bob Menendez in New York
item.dc:creator: Julia Jester and Jonathan Dienst and Dareh Gregorian and Erik Ortiz
item.description: Jury selection begins in the criminal trial of Sen. Bob Menendez, who's charged with accepting "hundreds of thousands of dollars" in bribes, including gold bars, for official acts.

media:content.media:text: Sen. Bob Menendez,
media:content.media:description: Jurors are being selected in Sen. Bob Menendez's bribery trial.

item.title: Parishioners stopped teen with a rifle from entering church with 60 children inside
item.dc:creator: Patrick Smith
item.description: Churchgoers thwarted a teenager armed with a rifle from entering a Louisiana church full of children Saturday in a service that was being livestreamed, authorities said.

media:content.media:text: A police officer walks through St. Mary Magdalen in Abbeville, La., after a teenager armed with a rifle tried to enter the church Saturday, May 11, 2024, in an image from the church's livestream.
media:content.media:description: A police officer walks through St. Mary Magdalen in Abbeville, La., after a teenager armed with a rifle tried to enter the church Saturday, in an image from the church's livestream.

item.title: 3rd trespassing reported at Drake's mansion as man from previous incident came back for bike
item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang and Diana Dasrath
item.description: A third trespassing incident unfolded Saturday at Drake’s Toronto mansion, authorities said.

media:content.media:text: Drake stands onstage during a concert
media:content.media:description: Drake onstage during his "Till Death Do Us Part" rap battle in Long Beach, Calif., on Oct. 30, 2021.

item.title: Crystal Dunn says the USWNT is ready for the Olympics, and hungry for gold
item.dc:creator: Michelle Garcia
item.description: Crystal Dunn, the veteran defender on the U.S. women’s national soccer team heading into the Olympics, says it’s about time people are taking notice of women’s sports.

media:content.media:text: Crystal Dunn
media:content.media:description: “I think the team is in a really good position to put our best foot forward,” U.S. women's national soccer team veteran Crystal Dunn says as they squad looks toward the Paris Olympics this summer.

media:content.media:text: Crystal Dunn on NBC's "TODAY" Show on April 15, 2024.
media:content.media:description: In April, Dunn and the U.S. team prevailed over Canada at the SheBelieves tournament, which she said is helping to prepare for the Olympic Games.

media:content.media:text: Crystal Dunn
media:content.media:description: Crystal Dunn in a match versus Brazil during the Concacaf W Gold Cup final in March. She says global tournaments have had "some of the best opposition that we could possibly play against going into an Olympics.”

item.title: How an unlikely bromance on Capitol Hill led to more weapons on the battlefield in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Peter Nicholas
item.description: The story is so familiar that by now it's a Capitol Hill cliche: Lawmakers from different parties meet in the gym and realize amid the clack of iron weights that they have more in common than not.

media:content.media:credit: CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images; NurPhoto via AP
media:content.media:text: politics political politicians
media:content.media:description: Sen. Markwayne Mullin, R-Okla, Rep. Josh Gottheimer, D-N.J.

item.title: Man gets realistic picture of his boat painted on fence intended to hide it
item.dc:creator: Patrick Smith
item.description: A California man who was ordered to keep his boat out of sight has had the last laugh — by commissioning an artist to paint a realistic image of it on the fence that obscures it.

media:content.media:text: Man paints boat on fence erected to conceal boat
media:content.media:description: A speedboat mural is painted on a fence outside the home of Etienne Constable in Seaside, Calif., after the city ordered Mr. Constable to conceal his boat.

item.title: Olivia Munn had hysterectomy amid cancer treatment, froze her eggs in hopes of more kids
item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang
item.description: Olivia Munn has revealed she underwent a hysterectomy, opening up about her journey with breast cancer in an interview with Vogue published Sunday on Mother’s Day.

media:content.media:text: Olivia Munn attends the 2024 Vanity Fair Oscar Party.
media:content.media:description: Olivia Munn attends the 2024 Vanity Fair Oscar Party.

item.title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: Sound and Fury
item.description: When the wife of a popular Atlanta DJ is found murdered in their home, investigators try to unravel what happened. Stephanie Gosk reports Friday, May 10, at 9/8c on NBC.

media:content.media:title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: Sound and Fury
media:content.media:description: When the wife of a popular Atlanta DJ is found murdered in their home, investigators try to unravel what happened. Stephanie Gosk reports Friday, May 10, at 9/8c on NBC.

item.title: U.S. museum curator allegedly tried to smuggle 1,500 dead spiders and scorpions out of Turkey
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: A curator at the American Museum of Natural History was detained in Istanbul on Monday while allegedly attempting to smuggle spider and scorpion samples, Turkish media reported.

media:content.media:text: Scorpion in a test tube on a table of evidence
media:content.media:description: Scorpions and spiders from Turkey, found in an alleged smuggling operation in Istanbul, on May 13, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Bags containing scorpions and spiders displayed on a table during a press conference
media:content.media:description: Bags containing various scorpions and spiders from Turkey found in an alleged smuggling operation in Istanbul, on May 13, 2024.

item.title: Taquerías rally to help save L.A. food website that put many of them on the map
item.dc:creator: Albinson Linares, Noticias Telemundo
item.description: L.A. Taco, the Los Angeles-based website that focuses on street food, especially tacos, is struggling financially and taquerías, readers and others have responded, pointing to its crucial role boosting small business owners and doing community journalism.

media:content.media:text: workers are assembling bags of orders for pick-up, take-out and delivery
media:content.media:description: The owners of Sonoratown, a taquería with now two locations, are among those rallying to support the website L.A. Taco, whose early praise for their food helped their initial taquería succeed.

media:content.media:text: Javier Cabral, editor en jefe de L.A. Taco, en Los Ángeles, California, el 25 de abril de 2024.
media:content.media:description: L.A. Taco editor-in-chief Javier Cabral said he's been touched by the support they've received, including from people who have moved away from L.A. but have become members to support them.

item.title: Amazon's Zoox under investigation by NHTSA after two robotaxi crashes
item.dc:creator: Annie Palmer, CNBC
item.description: U.S. safety regulators have opened a probe into Amazon-owned robotaxi venture Zoox after two of its autonomous SUVs braked suddenly and were rear-ended by motorcyclists.

media:content.media:text: Toyota Highlander equipped with Zoox self-driving software on a street in Foster City, Calif.,
media:content.media:description: Zoox testing its self-driving software in Foster City, Calif., on Feb. 20, 2023.

item.title: What to shop (and skip) this Memorial Day
item.dc:creator: Zoe Malin
item.description: The best Memorial Day sales are on furniture, appliances, mattresses and spring clothing. Learn what stores are open on Memorial Day and how to save the most money.

media:content.media:text: Some retailers extend their sales beyond Memorial Day but typically offer the best deals during the holiday weekend.
media:content.media:description: Some retailers extend their sales beyond Memorial Day but typically offer the best deals during the holiday weekend.

item.title: U.S. autoworkers union seeks tough victory at Mercedes plant in Alabama
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Workers at a Mercedes-Benz plant in Alabama began voting Monday on whether to join the United Auto Workers union, a significant test of whether the labor group can maintain momentum in the historically anti-union American South.

media:content.media:text: U.S. auto workers union seeks tough victory at Mercedes plant in Alabama
media:content.media:description: Volkswagen automobile plant employee Kiara Hughes celebrates after employees voted to join the UAW union on April 19, 2024, in Chattanooga, Tenn.

item.title: Kansas City Chiefs to host Baltimore Ravens in first game of 2024 NFL season
item.dc:creator: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
item.description: The Kansas City Chiefs’ quest for a third consecutive Super Bowl will begin in front of the entire country.

media:content.media:text: Patrick Mahomes runs with the football during a game between the Kansas City Chiefs and Baltimore Ravens
media:content.media:description: Patrick Mahomes during a game between the Kansas City Chiefs and Baltimore Ravens, on Jan. 28, 2024 in Baltimore.

item.title: GameStop shares jump 30% as trader 'Roaring Kitty' posts online for first time in years
item.dc:creator: Yun Li, CNBC and Fred Imbert, CNBC
item.description: GameStop shares rallied dramatically on Monday after “Roaring Kitty,” the man who inspired the epic short squeeze of 2021, posted online for the first time in roughly three years.

media:content.media:text: People walk passed a GameStop store in Brooklyn.
media:content.media:description: GameStop store in Brooklyn, N.Y., in 2021.
